project.name: base
project.description: The Base System Project provides an umbrella project for keeping the system tools, libraries, compilers and layout consistent for all the various architectures under Gentoo Linux.
project.longdescription: Gentoo Base System aims to provide a consistency in compilers, libc's, filesystem layouts and startup scripts across all the architectures which Gentoo Linux supports. We try to provide maximum usability and flexibility to allow for porting to any architecture supported by the Linux kernel.
project.goals: To provide a set of stable and secure system level applications and libraries. The most visible and obvious among them are: baselayout and the initscript system, gcc, gcc-config, and glibc.

extraproject.name: Alpha
extraproject.p: A port of Gentoo Linux to the DEC/Compaq/HP Alpha processors. We hope to have a project page with the status of that port up soon.

extraproject.name: AMD64
extraproject.p: This is a port of Gentoo Linux to the 64-bit AMD (Hammer) platform. Work on this is ongoing, and we hope to have a project page up to deliver progress reports on it soon.

extraproject.name: IA-64
extraproject.p: This is a port of Gentoo Linux to the 64-bit Intel (Itanium series) platform. Work on this is ongoing, albeit slower than we would like. A project page will be up as soon as we have some progress to report.

body.p: We are always willing to talk to talented programmers and people familiar with the GNU Compiler Collection, GNU/libc, our initscript system or specialists with particular knowledge of hardware architecture to improve the speed and stability of Gentoo Linux on any or all of our platforms. Please contact base-system at gentoo dot org to talk with us. If you would like more information on a particular architecture, please click the appropriate link in the above table, and contact the personnel of that particular architecture.
